newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yaohan up on group asset sales talk.
newsitem.headline: Yaohan up on group asset sales talk.

text.p: Shares in Yaohan Japan Corp jumped in Monday morning trade on news that the Yaohan group was negotiating to sell assets, brokers said.
As of 0127 GMT, the shares of the supermarket chain operator were up 19 yen or 13.48 percent at 160 yen, the largest percentage gainer on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.

"The news is a sign that the firm is starting to firm up its restructuring plans, which is encouraging for investors," a broker at a "Big Four" brokerage said. Yaohan Japan said on Monday that Yaohan International Holdings Ltd (YIH) is negotiating with a Chinese partner over the sale of part of YIH's stake in a department store in Shanghai.
A Yaohan Japan official also said a unit of Yaohan Japan is in talks with Best Denki Co Ltd over the sale of retail chains which sell home electrical appliances.
Both YIH and Yaohan Japan are key members of the Yaohan group.
